page.title: 17Biography (cont).....
page.content: What was the old cinema is now the bingo hall sited on the High Street. After work the men would go for a pint of beer, for atleast 2d, at one of several pubs in Kippax. Eleven pubs can be remembered by local people, plus beer houses. Children played with dolls there were street games like Kick the can, Hide and seek, and spinning tops. Holiday tended to be day trips to places like Morcombe, perhaps twice a year. For holidays people often visited their freinds. In boarding houses, holidays could be made cheaper if you provided your own fasciiities, ie bedding and food. Most holidays taken were for only half a day. Christmas was looked forward to for a two day break. Children toured the village carol singing for half pennies.
